ai-mil5.5.11:1.1_0: “When the Buddha spoke like this, he said,
ai-mil5.5.11:3.1_0: And he had spoken to him.
ai-mil5.5.11:3.2_0: And that is how my teacher Āḷāra Kālāma placed me, his student, on the same position as him, and honored me with lofty praise.
ai-mil5.5.11:3.3_0: And he told him about this,
ai-mil5.5.11:3.4_0: ‘I have no equal or better than me.
ai-mil5.5.11:3.5_0: Thinking: ‘In this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—whatever teachers me, his pupils.’
ai-mil5.5.11:3.6_0: When the Realized One had spoken,
ai-mil5.5.11:3.7_0: ‘So it is that my teacher Āḷāra Kālāma placed me, his student, on the same position as him, and honored me with that.
ai-mil5.5.11:3.8_0: and I haven’t spoken of that.
ai-mil5.5.11:3.9_0: This is a bowl and robes that should be extinguished before you.”
ai-mil5.5.11:4.1_0: “Great king, well spoken by the Realized One,
ai-mil5.5.11:6.1_0: And they had lied to him.
ai-mil5.5.11:6.2_0: And that is how my teacher Āḷāra Kālāma placed me, his student, on the same position as him, and honored me with lofty praise.
ai-mil5.5.11:7.1_0: But before my teacher, he spoke like this to his teacher.
ai-mil5.5.11:8.1_0: Before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I’ve entered the host of Joyful Gods.
ai-mil5.5.11:8.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by five?
ai-mil5.5.11:8.3_0: Those brahmins who are born from the being intent on awakening are born from the mother of the being intent on awakening—here, that is:
ai-mil5.5.11:8.4_0: So that Lakkhaṇa is fortunate, so very fortunate,
ai-mil5.5.11:8.5_0: And they made them safely, and doctors.
ai-mil5.5.11:9.1_0: Furthermore, after his father, a worker, the king of mountains, was his ministers and counselors, to recite the hymns in front of them. This is the second drain, and gave him a blow.
ai-mil5.5.11:10.1_0: Furthermore, the deities came out to stay in that host of awakening. This is the third lost opportunity, but they remained in that teacher.
ai-mil5.5.11:11.1_0: Furthermore, this is the fourth kind of teacher.
ai-mil5.5.11:12.1_0: Furthermore, a teacher describes the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. This is the fifth kind of teacher.
ai-mil5.5.11:13.1_0: Before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I saw his teacher five kinds of teachers.
ai-mil5.5.11:13.2_0: And those teachers are impressive and pride.
ai-mil5.5.11:13.3_0: And the Realized One has no question about all things.
ai-mil5.5.11:15.1_0: “It’s good, sir, that I reflect like this.”
ai-mil5.5.11:17.1_0: The fifth sub-chapter on laughing loudly is finished.
ai-mil5.5.11:19.1_0: The section on Meṇḍaka is finished.
